page.title: 04Hannington's Religion
page.content: We have two churches, the All Saints C of E(mentioned in the Domesday Book) attended by the majority. The Rector is John Franks who lives in the next village of Wolverton & who officiates in that Parish and two others. Because of this, laymen take Sunday services when the Rector is preaching the sermon in the next Parish. Bellringers summon the inhabitants to services. There is a small adjacent graveyard. The Methodist congregation is small in number but regular attenders & include members of the Silver Band. This church was built in 1871. The Roman Catholic services are held in Kings - clere, so members of this faith have to travel 4 miles to worship. There is no animosity between the churches.
